intro: Halogeton purpureus, commonly known as the purple sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, saline environments, storing water in its thick, lobed leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Halogeton purpureus is often found in sandy soils and is considered an indicator species of disturbed or degraded habitats.
